sub_topic: Finding the cross product of two vectors using trigonometry
message_1:
A math student is given two vectors: 

u = 3i - 2j + 4k 

v = 5i + 3j - k 

Using trigonometry, find the cross product of the two vectors.
message_2:
To find the cross product of two vectors, we use the following formula:

u x v = (u_y * v_z - u_z * v_y)i - (u_x * v_z - u_z * v_x)j + (u_x * v_y - u_y * v_x)k

Given the vectors:

u = 3i - 2j + 4k
v = 5i + 3j - k

We can find the cross product as follows:

u x v = ((-2) * (-1) - 4 * 3)i - (3 * (-1) - 4 * 5)j + (3 * 3 - (-2) * 5)k
u x v = (2 - 12)i - (-3 - 20)j + (9 + 10)k
u x v = -10i + 23j + 19k

So, the cross product of the two vectors is:

u x v = -10i + 23j + 19k
